weather_report:
The morning light in Downtown San Francisco sifts through a delicate veil of clouds, hinting at a day of varied moods. The atmosphere carries a palpable sense of anticipation as the forecast calls for rain this afternoon. With temperatures hovering around the low fifties, it presents a chilly yet inviting landscape, encouraging one to layer up before stepping outside. As the day unfolds, those winds, whispering softly from the east, will give way to more boisterous gusts sweeping in from the south, promising to stir the air and shake off the remnants of winter slumber.

By mid-afternoon, the clouds will thickly blanket the sky, laden with expectation, punctuated by the inevitable downpour later in the day. Visibility may diminish as fog begins to creep in, softening the edges of familiar views—transforming the iconic Golden Gate into a mere silhouette against the backdrop of gray. If you find yourself in this picturesque city, perhaps the best course of action would be to seek refuge in a cozy café, nurse a warm beverage, and watch the rain dance against the window. It is a day to savor the stillness of a good book or engage in quiet conversation, allowing the city’s rhythm to flow over you as you wait for the comforting embrace of another evening.
